name: ETL Processes and Data Warehousing

topics.description: This topic introduces the fundamental concepts of Extract, Transform, Load (ETL) processes. You will learn the three core stages of ETL: extracting data from various sources, transforming it into a consistent format, and loading it into a target data warehouse.  Understanding ETL is essential for building effective data warehouses.
references: Inmon, W. H. (1992). Building the data warehouse. John Wiley & Sons.
Kimball, R. (1996). The data warehouse toolkit: The complete guide to dimensional modeling. John Wiley & Sons.

topics.description: This topic delves into various data sources commonly encountered in ETL processes, including relational databases, NoSQL databases, cloud storage, APIs, and flat files.  You will learn techniques for connecting to these diverse data sources and extracting relevant information.

This topic explores various data transformation techniques used in ETL pipelines.  You will learn about data cleansing, data type conversion, aggregation, and data enrichment techniques.  We will also discuss the importance of data quality and validation in ETL processes.
references: Agrawal, R., & Sarawagi, S. (2000). Data Cleaning: Problems, Techniques, and Applications. SIGMOD Record, 29(2), 17-24.

topics.description: This topic focuses on designing and implementing efficient ETL pipelines using tools such as Apache Airflow, Apache NiFi, or Azure Data Factory. You will learn about scheduling, monitoring, and troubleshooting ETL workflows.

This topic examines different data warehousing architectures, including star schema, snowflake schema, and galaxy schema. You will learn about the advantages and disadvantages of each architecture and how to choose the best one for your specific data warehouse needs.

description: Explore Extract, Transform, Load (ETL) processes and their role in building data warehouses. Learn techniques for data integration and transformation.
aims: Design and implement an ETL pipeline for data ingestion and transformation.
Apply data transformation techniques using tools like SQL and Python.
Analyze and optimize ETL processes for performance and efficiency.
